BR_text.BRsummary: using cocoapi to show .json file converted by coco/converter.py meets key error
BR_text.BRdescription:
the used code of cocoapi is as follows:
 # get all images containing given categories, select one at random  
 catIds = coco.getCatIds(catNms=['person','dog','skateboard']);
 imgIds = coco.getImgIds(catIds=catIds );
 imgIds = coco.getImgIds(imgIds = [324158])
 img = coco.loadImgs(imgIds[np.random.randint(0,len(imgIds))])[0]
 function coco.loadImgs() meets key error
 I adjust the code of converter.py as follows:
 def insert_image_data(image, path_to_images, result_annotation):
     ...
     new_img['id'] = image['id'] # -> new_img['id'] = int(image['id'])
     ...
 def insert_annotation_data(image, category_map, segm_id, object, img_dims, result_annotation):
     ...
     new_anno['image_id'] = image['id'] # -> new_anno['image_id'] = int(image['id'])
 then, it works. Is that right?

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/DmitriySidnev>@DmitriySidnev</denchmark-link>
 , could you please look into this?

comments_1.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/stormchasingg>@stormchasingg</denchmark-link>
 , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nmanovic>@nmanovic</denchmark-link>
   Hi! Yes, this is right. Image id must be an integer but the field has a string type. I will create a pull request with the fix.
